sen.j: 山岡 景友（やまおか かげとも）は、戦国時代 (日本)から安土桃山時代の武将。
sen.e: Kagetomo Yamaoka was the Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku and the Azuchi-Momoyama Periods.
Kagetomo YAMAOKA was the Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring State) and the Azuchi-Momoyama Period.
sen.cmt: ・"Yamaoka"を"YAMAOKA"としました。・「戦国時代」の訳を用語集に従い書き換えました。
sen.e: Kagetomo YAMAOKA was the Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring State) and the Azuchi-Momoyama Period.

sen.j: 六角氏旧臣。近世大名。常陸古渡藩初代藩主。
sen.e: A former retainer of the Rokkaku clan The Kinsei (early modern) daimyo The first lord of the Futsuto clan in Hitachi Province.
He was a former retainer of the Rokkaku clan, a kinsei daimyo (Japanese modern feudal lord), and the first lord of Futsuro domain in Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: はじめの２つの文の訳にピリオドが抜けていたことから、3つのセルをひとつにまとめつつ、訂正しました。
sen.e: He was a former retainer of the Rokkaku clan, a kinsei daimyo (Japanese modern feudal lord), and the first lord of Futsuro domain in Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 山岡景隆および山岡景猶の実弟である。
sen.e: He was a real younger brother of Kagetaka and Kagenao YAMAOKAs.
He was the biological younger brother of Kagetaka and Kagenao YAMAOKA.
He was the biological younger brother of Kagetaka and Kagenao YAMAOKA.

sen.j: 天文9年（1540年）、六角氏家臣の山岡景之の4男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born the fourth son of Kageyuki YAMAOKA, a retainer of the Rokkaku clan.
He was born in 1540 as the fourth son of Kageyuki YAMAOKA, a retainer of the Rokkaku clan.
sen.cmt: 「天文９年」の訳が抜けていたので追加しました。
sen.e: He was born in 1540 as the fourth son of Kageyuki YAMAOKA, a retainer of the Rokkaku clan.

sen.j: 山岡氏は守護六角氏の有力家臣で、青地氏らとともに六角軍の軍事の中枢を担っていた。
sen.e: The YAMAOKA clan was the powerful vassal of the Shugo (provincial military governor) ROKKAKU clan and was in charge of the military affairs of the ROKKAKU force together with the AOCHI clan and other clans.

The Yamaoka clan was the powerful retainer of the Shugo (provincial military governor) Rokkaku clan and was in charge of the military affairs of the Rokkaku army together with the Aochi clan and other clans.
sen.cmt: YAMAOKA,ROKKAKU,AOCHIを小文字にしました。また、上のセルに合わせ、"vassal"を"retainer"にしました。
sen.e: The Yamaoka clan was the powerful retainer of the Shugo (provincial military governor) Rokkaku clan and was in charge of the military affairs of the Rokkaku army together with the Aochi clan and other clans.

sen.j: はじめ山岡家の領地内にあった三井寺光浄院の僧侶となり、暹慶（せんけい）と号していたが将軍義昭の命で還俗して景友と名乗る。
sen.e: He first became a monk named Senkei, at the Mii-dera Temple Kojoin, which was located in the territory of the YAMAOKA clan; however, he returned to secular by order from the Shogun Yoshiaki and named himself Kagetomo.

He first became a monk in Kojoin at Mii-dera Temple which was located in the territory of the Yamaoka clan, and he called himself "Senkei," but he returned to secular life due to the order by Shogun Yoshiaki and started calling himself "Kagetomo."
sen.cmt: 文の構造を少し変えました。
sen.e: He first became a monk in Kojoin at Mii-dera Temple which was located in the territory of the Yamaoka clan, and he called himself "Senkei," but he returned to secular life due to the order by Shogun Yoshiaki and started calling himself "Kagetomo."

sen.j: 同じく最初は僧侶であった第15代将軍・足利義昭により引き立てられ室町幕府より山城国半国の守護に任じられた。
sen.e: He was backed by the 15th Shogun Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA who was first a monk like Kagetomo was and was appointed the Shugo of half of Yamashiro Province.

He was backed by the 15th Shogun Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA who was first a monk like Kagetomo was, and he was appointed the Shugo of half of Yamashiro Province by Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: ・「室町幕府より」を訳出しました。
sen.e: He was backed by the 15th Shogun Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA who was first a monk like Kagetomo was, and he was appointed the Shugo of half of Yamashiro Province by Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 信長包囲網が敷かれ信長と義昭の戦いが始まると義昭に従って信長と敵対し、近江石山城に立て籠もって抗戦した。
sen.e: He followed Yoshiaki, fought against Nobunaga, and holed up in the Ishiyama-jo Castle in the Omi Province when the battle between Nobunaga and Yoshiaki begun as Nobunaga was under siege.
He followed Yoshiaki and fought against Nobunaga holing up in Ishiyama-jo Castle in Omi Province when the battle between Nobunaga and Yoshiaki began and Nobunaga was under siege.
sen.cmt: 文を少し変えました。"begun"を"began"に訂正しました（スペルミス）。
sen.e: He followed Yoshiaki and fought against Nobunaga holing up in Ishiyama-jo Castle in Omi Province when the battle between Nobunaga and Yoshiaki began and Nobunaga was under siege.

sen.j: （この時他の兄弟は義昭を裏切り信長方に付いた）
sen.e: (His brothers betrayed him and took the side of Nobunaga during the battle.)
(On this occasion, his brothers betrayed Yoshiaki and took the side of Nobunaga.)
sen.cmt: 「この時」の訳を"during the battle"から"on this occasion"に変えました。"him"が誰を指すのかわかりづらかったので、"Yoshiaki"と訳出しました。
sen.e: (On this occasion, his brothers betrayed Yoshiaki and took the side of Nobunaga.)

sen.j: 元亀4年（1573年）2月26日に信長の部将である柴田勝家に攻められたが、信長方に付いた兄・景隆の説得を受けて降伏・開城した。
sen.e: He was attacked by Katsuie SHIBATA, the Busho (commanding officer) of Nobunaga, on Februrary 26, 1573; however, he surrenderred and left the castle after being persuated by Kagetaka, his older brother who took the side of Nobunaga.

After he was attacked by Katsuie SHIBATA, a busho (commanding officer) of Nobunaga, on April 8, 1573, he surrendered and left the castle because he was persuaded by Kagetaka, his older brother who took the side of Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: ・文構造を少し変えました。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。 ・"surrenderred"を"surrendered"に、"pursuated"を"persuaded"に訂正しました（スペルミス）。
sen.e: After he was attacked by Katsuie SHIBATA, a busho (commanding officer) of Nobunaga, on April 8, 1573, he surrendered and left the castle because he was persuaded by Kagetaka, his older brother who took the side of Nobunaga.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）6月、本能寺の変で信長が死去すると、兄と共に明智光秀軍の近江国進撃を妨害した。
sen.e: After Nobunaga died during the Honnoji Incident in June 1582, Kagetomo, together with his oder brother obstructed the advancement of the Mitsuhide AKECHI force toward Omi Province.
After Nobunaga died due to Honnoji Incident in June 1582, Kagetomo obstructed the advance of the Mitsuhide AKECHI force toward Omi Province with his older brother.
sen.cmt: ・"during"を"due to"にしました。・"oder"を"older"に訂正しました（スペルミス）。・"advancement"を"advance"に訂正しました。
sen.e: After Nobunaga died due to Honnoji Incident in June 1582, Kagetomo obstructed the advance of the Mitsuhide AKECHI force toward Omi Province with his older brother.

sen.j: 兄景隆たちが柴田勝家に付き羽柴秀吉により領地没収となるなどしたため、山岡氏家督となる。
sen.e: Kagetaka, his brother, and others forfeited their land since they took the side of Katsuie SHIBATA; therefore, Kagetomo succeeded the family estate of the YAMAOKA clan.
Since his older brother Kagetaka and others were forfeited their land by Hideyoshi HASHIBA as they took the side of Katsuie SHIBATA, Kagetomo succeeded the family headship of the Yamaoka clan.
sen.cmt: ・「羽柴秀吉により」を訳出しました。・"forfeited"を"were forfeited"に訂正しました。・「家督」の訳を以下のウェブサイトに従い"family headship"としました。http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~jwb/cgi-bin/wwwjdic.cgi?1F
sen.e: Since his older brother Kagetaka and others were forfeited their land by Hideyoshi HASHIBA as they took the side of Katsuie SHIBATA, Kagetomo succeeded the family headship of the Yamaoka clan.

sen.j: 兄が持っていた甲賀における権利の一部を継承する。
sen.e: He inherited a partial right in the Koga region which was owned by his older brother.
He inherited a partial right of Koga region which was owned by his older brother.
He inherited a partial right of Koga region which was owned by his older brother.

sen.j: 信長の死後、天下人に台頭した豊臣秀吉の家臣となり領地を安堵され、秀吉の信頼をうけ御伽衆にも加えられた。
sen.e: After the death of Nobunaga, Kagetomo became a retainer of Hideyoshi Toyotomi who came to power; thus, his territory was saved and he was appointed a member of the Otogishu, after gaining Hideyoshi's trust.

After the death of Nobunaga, Kagetomo became a retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who came to power, so his territory was saved, and besides, he was appointed a member of Otogishu (advisers) after he got trusted by Hideyoshi.
sen.cmt: "Toyotomi"を"TOYOTOMI"としました。・otogishuの説明を加えました。・単語を少し変えました。
sen.e: After the death of Nobunaga, Kagetomo became a retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who came to power, so his territory was saved, and besides, he was appointed a member of Otogishu (advisers) after he got trusted by Hideyoshi.

sen.j: 領地の関係で大津城主の京極高次と親しかった。
sen.e: Kagetomo was close to Takatsugi KYOGOKU, who was the lord of the Otsu-jo Castle because of their territories.
Kagetomo was close to Takatsugu KYOGOKU, who was the lord of the Otsu-jo Castle because of their territories.
sen.cmt: "Takatsugi"を"Takatsugu"と訂正しました（スペルミス）。
sen.e: Kagetomo was close to Takatsugu KYOGOKU, who was the lord of the Otsu-jo Castle because of their territories.

sen.j: 後に再び剃髪して道阿弥と号した。
sen.e: He returned to be a monk and named himself Doami.
He returned to be a monk and called himself Doami.
He returned to be a monk and called himself Doami.

sen.j: 天正20年（1592年）の文禄の役では秀吉に従って肥前国名護屋城に在陣した。
sen.e: He stayed at the Nagoya-jo Castle in Hizen Province with Hideyoshi in the Bunroku War in 1592.
In addition, he stayed at Nagoya-jo Castle in Hizen Province with Hideyoshi in the Imjin War in 1592.
sen.cmt: ・上のセルの文とのつながりを考え"in addition"を追加しました。・「文禄の役」を"the Imjin War"としました。
sen.e: In addition, he stayed at Nagoya-jo Castle in Hizen Province with Hideyoshi in the Imjin War in 1592.

sen.j: 秀吉没後は徳川家康に接近し、慶長5年（1600年）9月の関ヶ原の戦いでは東軍に属して伊勢国長島城の守備や伊勢桑名城・近江国水口城を攻略に功績を挙げた。
sen.e: He became close to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA after the death of Hideyoshi and accomplished great achievements including the defending the Nagashima-jo Castle in Ise Province and capturing the Kuwana-jo Castle in Ise Provincei and the Minakuchi-jo Castle in Omi Province by joining the East force during the Battle of Sekigahara in September 1600.

He became close to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA after the death of Hideyoshi, and in the Battle of Sekigahara in October 1600, he belonged to the eastern army and had great achievements such as the defense of Nagashima-jo Castle in Ise Province and the capture of Kuwana-jo Castle in Ise Province and Minakuchi-jo Castle in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: ・"Ise Provincei"を"Ise Province"に訂正しました（スペルミス）。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He approached Ieyasu TOKUGAWA after the death of Hideyoshi, and in the Battle of Sekigahara in October 1600, he belonged to the eastern army and had great achievements such as the defense of Nagashima-jo Castle in Ise Province and the capture of Kuwana-jo Castle in Ise Province and Minakuchi-jo Castle in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: became close to→approached内容を修正しました。

sen.j: この功績により、戦後に家康より近江国内で9000石を与えられ、同時に甲賀組を与えられた。
sen.e: He was awarded 9000 Goku in Omi Province from Ieyasu after the battle because of his accomplishments during the battle and was also awarded the Kogagumi at the same time.
He was awarded 9,000 Goku crop yields in Omi Province from Ieyasu after the battle because of his achievements of the battle and was also awarded the Koga-gumi group at the same time.
sen.cmt: ・"Goku"のあとに"crop yields"を足しました。・「甲賀組」の定訳なしです。
sen.e: He was awarded 9,000 Goku crop yields in Omi Province from Ieyasu after the battle because of his achievements of the battle and was also awarded the Koga-gumi group at the same time.

sen.j: また高野山に籠った京極高次の説得時にも活躍した。
sen.e: Moreover, he played an active role during the persuation of Takatsugu Kyogoku who confined himself to Mt. Koya.
Also, he played an active role of persuading Takatsugu KYOGOKU who holed up in Mt. Koya.
sen.cmt: "during"を"of"にし、"confined himself"を"holed up in"にしました。・"Kyogoku"を"KYOGOKU"と大文字にしました。
sen.e: Also, he played an active role of persuading Takatsugu KYOGOKU who holed up in Mt. Koya.

sen.j: 慶長8年（1603年）には石高を加増されて常陸古渡1万石（常陸古渡藩）の大名となる。
sen.e: He became the Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of the Futsuto 10,000 Goku in the Hitachi Province (the Futsuto clan in the Hitachi clan) after his Kokudaka was increased in 1603.
He became daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of Hitachi Futsuto 10,000 Goku crop yields (Futsuto domain in Hitachi Province) after his Kokudaka (crop yield) was increased in 1603.
sen.cmt: 「石」「石高」に説明をつけました。また、"clan"を"domain""province"にしました。
sen.e: He became daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of Hitachi Futsuto 10,000 Goku crop yields (Futsuto domain in Hitachi Province) after his Kokudaka (crop yield) was increased in 1603.

sen.j: 室町幕府の奉公衆と親しく、政所の政所代を代々勤めていた蜷川氏の蜷川親長とも親交があった。
sen.e: He was friend with the Hokoshu in the Muromachi Period including Chikanaga NINAGAWA of the NINAGAWA clan which served the proxy official of Mandokoro (Administrative Board) for generations.

He was close with the Hokoshu (the shogunal military guard) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and he was also associated with Chikanaga NINAGAWA of the NINAGAWA clan which served the proxy officer of Mandokoro (Administrative Board) for generations.
sen.cmt: ・「奉公衆」の説明を加えました。・"Muromachi Period"を原文に従い"Muromachi bakufu"に訂正しました。・「奉公衆」と「政所代」とは役職が異なるので、"including"を"and…"と訂正しました。・"official"を用語集に従い"officer"にしました。
sen.e: He was close with the Hokoshu (the shogunal military guard) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and he was also associated with Chikanaga NINAGAWA of the NINAGAWA clan which served the proxy officer of Mandokoro (Administrative Board) for generations.

sen.j: 慶長8年（1603年）12月20日に死去。
sen.e: He died on December 20, 1603.
He died on January 21, 1604.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He died on January 21, 1604.

sen.j: 享年64。
sen.e: His age at death was 64.
He was 64 years old when he died.
sen.cmt: こちらのほうが自然かと思い、直しました。
sen.e: He was 64 years old when he died.

sen.j: 跡を甥（兄・景隆の7男）の山岡景以が継いだ。
sen.e: The family estate was succeeded by Kagemochi YAMAOKA, a nephew (his older brother's seventh son).
The family headship was succeeded by Kagemochi YAMAOKA, his nephew (his older brother Kagetaka's seventh son).
sen.cmt: family estateをfamily headshipとしました。「景隆」を訳文に挿入しました。
sen.e: The family headship was succeeded by Kagemochi YAMAOKA, his nephew (his older brother Kagetaka's seventh son).
